>  Unit testing : Using Mockobjects ( EasyMock) to test MessageService and
>  Deployment Service  [ Mocking  JMS objects using EasyMock. That will

Sounds good.


On 9/27/06, tester_junit <sujal14@...> wrote:
>  Integration Testing  : Using Cactus, Original JMS implementation to Test
>  for right messages  at the right queue.

Here I might opt for using an "embedded" ActiveMQ JMS server instead
of the Real Thing, essentially running integration tests outside of a
container, leaving that for system tests.

You can create an embedded ActiveMQ server with a one-liner:

        ActiveMQConnectionFactory broker = new ActiveMQConnectionFactory(
                "vm://localhost?broker.persistent=false");

The 'broker' object implements the QueueConnectionFactory and
TopicConnectionFactory interfaces, letting you populate those into a
fake JNDI tree, for example, or to inject them directly into your MDB
instance if you're using EJB3.
